hypothesis_content.title: Overnight Gap Fade in Low-Volume Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: If BTC opens with a gap >1.2% relative to its 00:00 UTC price (using hourly closes) during a NEUTRAL regime, and the hourly volume at the opening candle is below its 20-day median for that same hour-of-day, the gap will be >70% filled within the next 3 trading hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Gaps on low volume in neutral regimes are often driven by thin, illiquid overnight markets and are prone to fade as broader market participation arrives. The lack of volume confirms absence of strong directional conviction.
entry_conditions: BTC price at 01:00 UTC candle open gaps > |1.2%| from 00:00 UTC close
Volume during 01:00 UTC candle < 20-day median volume for the 01:00 UTC candle
Enter short if gap up, long if gap down at 01:05 UTC

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to 70% of the gap fill level (i.e., from entry, move equal to 0.7 * gap size)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves against entry by 0.5 times the initial gap size

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Gap fill rate of 70% is achieved in less than 60% of qualifying instances over a 100+ sample.
